sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a trapezium.
message_1: A trapezium has parallel sides of lengths 7 cm and 13 cm respectively. The other two sides are both 5 cm and the height of the trapezium is 8 cm. What is the perimeter of the trapezium?
message_2:
To find the perimeter of the trapezium, we simply add up the lengths of all four sides.

Perimeter = (first parallel side) + (second parallel side) + (first non-parallel side) + (second non-parallel side)

Perimeter = (7 cm) + (13 cm) + (5 cm) + (5 cm)

Perimeter = 30 cm

The perimeter of the trapezium is 30 cm.
